result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P. Schindler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: With huber privileges but no good time.  Jail to commence on or before 4/8/2016.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment/evaluations per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in two workings days if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Advised rights to an attorney.  Address is correct and defendant does qualify.  State request $500 cash bond w/ conditions.   Attorney Middleton request signature bond. Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with M.Z. & A.Z. or their residence and property.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs unless defendant has valid Rx.
